title: rogue-like dungeon crawler
description:
In a team of four we tried to develop an interesting dungeon crawler game in Java using Ashley (in order to learn ECS and stuff). Personally, I was in charge of e.g. fov system, fog of war system, path-finding algorithms, procedural map generation and ai.

More info and sourcecode on github.

title: interstellar shopkeeper
description:
This is more of a web service than an actual game, I tried to develop the most intuitive UI for the end user. Implemented a lot of animations in css (utilising js/ts when necessary), game stores its data on client's side in local storage for the most part, updating the DOM (react-like). Everything was made from scratch without using any 3rd part libraries.

Play here , view sourcecode.

title: algorithms library
description:
A library for algorithms showcase and usage presentation. I went with header only library so that the end user would not worry about linkage etc (also I use a lot of templates in this project). I implemented fully customizable segment trees and ternary search trees.

Get it on github.

title: twitter clone
description:
As I mentioned in my experience tab, as a part of my job @ SIO2project I was asked to built a twitter clone application in order to grasp the basics of Django framework (and python too!). This site is a simple rip-off from the original one (not using redis but the design is better :])

Try it online or look at the sources here.

title: turnstiles
description:
Implementation of turnstiles from the FreeBSD/NetBSD/Solaris kernel in order to lower the memory footprint of usual mutexes in C++11. Long story short, a single thread cannot sleep on more than one mutex at a time and this fact allows all mutexes to be just placeholders.

Read more about the implementation here.

title: mario the game
description:
An interactive game to help visualize the Dijkstra's algorithm. Made entirely in angular, there are limited game resources like map etc, game was made in one weekend for a competition on our university which it won.

Play it here.
